items.def: Inscription naming Pontius Pilatus Prefect of Judea relevant because it confirms the title and office named in the Gospels
Crucifixion victim with nail through heel relevant because it demonstrates Roman crucifixion practice in first century Judea
Ossuary inscribed with the high priestly name Caiaphas relevant because it matches the priestly figure in the trial narratives
Excavation uncovered five porticoes as in John 5:2 relevant because it validates a once doubted topographical detail in John
Pavement inscription naming a city treasurer Erastus relevant because it aligns with Romans 16:23 and local civic titles
Aramaic inscription mentioning the House of David relevant because it provides the earliest extrabiblical reference to the Davidic dynasty
Royal policy allowing repatriation of exiles relevant because it fits Ezra 1 on the return from Babylon
Assyrian account of the siege of Jerusalem relevant because it parallels 2 Kings 18-19 and supports the historical setting
